page.title: 07PADBURY METHODIST CHAPEL
page.content: Padbury Methodist Chapel is attached to the Buckingham, Bicester and Brackley circuit of the Methodist Church.The superintendant Minister lives in Buckingham. There are 5 members and for administrative purposes it is joined with Gawcott Chapel.A service is held each Sunday at 3 p.m. when the congregation usually consists of about 12 people. The service is mainly taken by local preachers. At the same time as the service a Sunday School is held for village children of all denominations. During the winter months Padbury takes its turn in holding Methodist Guild meetings. The present Chapel dates from 1876. Prior to that meetings were held in a cottage which still bears the name Wesley Cottage. When this cottage was sold the money was kept in trust for the upkeep of the Chapel.
